thread.title: New Worry for CEOs: Rising Costs From Metals to Meat

author: Andrew Tangel
title: New Worry for CEOs: Rising Costs From Metals to Meat
text:
U.S. manufacturers and food companies are grappling with rising material and ingredient costs on top of pressure from higher wages—a potential double whammy that could force them to raise prices or accept lower profit margins.

“We just see the inflation trends creeping in on many parts of our value chain,” Whirlpool Corp. Chief Executive Marc Bitzer told analysts recently. The Michigan-based appliance giant projected that additional raw-material costs, driven by rising prices of steel and resin, would shave as much as $250...
